definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: The old man is a survival of the past age.
sentences.chinese: 这老人乃上一个期间的遗老。

sentences.english: The old man was a survival of a past age.
sentences.chinese: 这位老人是上一代的遗老。

sentences.english: More than one hundred old fogies migrated to Qingdao occupied by Genmany after the Qing Dynasty's abdication.
sentences.chinese: 清廷逊位后，一百多名遗老客居德人占据的青岛。

sentences.english: Besides, who on earth is the old adherent?
sentences.chinese: 还有那个“遗老”指的究竟是谁？

definition: (lit.) leftover men/(fig.) loyalist adherents of a former dynasty/surviving members of an ethnic group
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
Gu Yanwu (1613-1682), late Ming and early Qing Confucian philosopher, linguist and historian, played a founding role in phonology of early Chinese, author of Rizhilu or Record of daily study 日知錄|日知录
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
experienced scholar/old expert in the field
late Ming cultural renewal movement, led by Zhang Pu 張溥|张溥[Zhang1 Pu3] and others
